intro: Pavetta fallax, commonly known as the Florida pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and hammocks. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a slightly glossy surface.
